text: Almost black color, coffee foam. Aroma: dark malt, wine, berries, black currant, brandy, currant leaves, cake. Taste mighty and juicy, berries, wine, sweet, coffee, very warming.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours black with a thin beige head. Caramel, roast, light berries. Taste is light sweet, fruit, leather, toffee. Long finish.

Bottle, thanks bluus. Pours a dark brown, black with a nice, one finger-sized, mocha-colored head. Aroma is roast, some coffee, more chocolate, slight sweet berriness, vanilla chocolate, perhaps? Taste is semi-sweet. Roast, coffee, slight chocolate, smooth finish. Some berries in the background.

Bottle @ home. Pours black with a mediumsized dark brown head with good retention and regeneration. Sour berries, roasted malt, dark wood and tobacco in the nose. The flavour has roasted malt, light sour black berries, wood, vanilla and tobacco. Medium to full body, medium sweet, light to medium acidic and medium bitter. Roasted and acidic finish

Pours black opaque/slightly hazy with dissipating brown head. Aroma: roasted grain, malts with notes of toasted toffee, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, black currant, burnt sugar...flavour follows aroma: roasted grain, malt flavours with notes of caramel, toasted toffee, dark & milk chocolate, coffee, cocoa, suplirted with flavours of burnt sugar, candy, black currant..
Finish is slightly sticky, dry. Body is s full, texture smooth, carbonation is low.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Black with a tan head. Nice aroma of cassis, chocolate, caramel, a bit of licorice. Sweet with a sourish cassis touch. Rounded, a bit of alcohol. Really good.
deep dark brown colour, medium sized creamy beige head; aroma and taste of blackcurrant, dried sour cherry and dark chocolate; great beer

Pitch black color. Thin offwhite head. Big molasses, dark chocolate and cassis in the nose. Very rich. The black currents just punch through the roasted malt and chocolate and give a nice sourness that goes well for the style. Very brash with the black current and maybe slightly over done but I do like it. Full body. Dark fruitdark chocolate just linger in the finish. Nice stuff.

Lots of berry, black currant. Sourish, robust, roasted and complex. Gentle. Not alcoholic. Warm

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
At the Dancing Camel, Pours black with a beige head, aroma of chocolate, cassis, cocoa, acidity, flavor is slightly sour with berries, chocolate, cocoa, medium bodied

funny how i only seem to drink at home when my girls are here and sleeping. This is a pretty cool brew. Currants, sugar, liquid chocolate, now milk choco, faint licorice, crusts. The dark milky chocolate thickens up as it sits - much like me. Although this mellowed up a bit after a long sit I preferred it colder. Berry stuff, sourness that is cool. The sourness does not overwhelm what so ever but is very apparent in every sip. Fruity, hidden bitterness on the finish, heavy malts. Caramel aroma has shown up in a very obvious way. I think the last third of this tiny ass bottle is basically all sediment.
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 Keg at The Bat. Pours black. Nose is sweet caramel, dark malts, prunes, light berries. Tastes berries, dried fruits, sweet, burnt caramel, light soy sauce.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2017 Keg at the hanging bat... Dark black.. Thin white lacing... Dark dry chocolate roast malts nose... Heavy dark fruits roast.. Dry chocolate roast malts... Light soft cherries finish.. Maybe just a little thin for style

330ml bottle pours black in colour with a finger and a half of off-white head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is currants with some chocolate and light roasted grains. Taste is a fruity and chocolate malty sweetness with a light roasted grain bitterness with a dry finish from the currants. Medium bodied with good carbonation that pleases the palate. Overall, a well balanced brew that is tasty and represents the style very well. Highly recommended.
Bottle from Kihoskh. Black with a small tan head. Roasted with chocolate, some berries, licorice and hints of soy sauce. The body was almost full and the finish fairly long.

330ml bottle. Pours an opaque dark brown almost black with lots of sediment floating around and a small, creamy, long lasting, light brown head that laces. Sweet aroma of chocolate malt, roast, black currants, caramel and licorice. Sweet flavour of chocolate malt, caramel, licorice and tart black currants with warming booze in a mildly bitter finish. Full body with a creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Baltic Porter, on par with the original. Nicely balanced, the ABV is well hidden. Delicious.

Bottle. Black with a medium sized dark brown head with good retention and regeneration. Sour berries, roasted malt, dark wood and tobacco in the nose. The flavour has roasted malt, light sour black berries, wood, vanilla and tobacco. Medium to full body, medium sweet, light to medium acidic and medium bitter. Roasted and acidic finish with some lingering sugar.

Pięknie się prezentuje, dwie piany - gruba kawowa i ciut mniej zbita wyższa jaśniejsza, w aromacie czarna pożeczka przebija typowo bałtykową słodowość i karmelowość, w smaku mamy powtorkę plus kawka, fajne ciało, zastrzeżenia mam do kwaskowatej kawy.

Bottle 330ml @ Parents place
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, berry, caramel, licorice and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, light to medium bitter and light sour with a long warm, licorice, chocolate, berry and light tart finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Piana drobna, beżowa, szybko opada do firanki. Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie gorzka czekolada, kawa espresso i czarna porzeczka, jagody, w tle nieco irytujący stary chmiel. W smaku czekoladowa słodycz, delikatna porzeczkowa kwaskowatość, lekka cierpkość, kawowa goryczka, śliwka, są nawet tytoniowe nuty w posmaku. Wysycenie średnie, nieco za wysokie, w odbiorze dość pełne, lepiące usta, z rozgrzewającym alkoholem.

Mniej mi podchodzi niż wersja podstawowa, ale to wciąż świetny, smakowity imperialny porter bałtycki.

On tap at Christian Firtal. Black with a lasting tan head. Roasted aroma with chocolate, licorice, caramel, red berries and (cheap) port wine. Sweet roasted flavour with berries and dark caramel, and a slightly hot alcohol.
Tap @ c4. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of roast, licorice, faint touch of berries, note of soy. Taste is roast, licorice, slight berries, slight spices

Svart med fingerhøyt lys brunt skum. Luktet kaffe, mørk sjokolade og tørket frukt. Mulig noe solbær baki der, men godt skjult. Søtlig start, kandis og bær. Middels bitterhet mot kaffe og mørk sjokkis. God blanding. Middels lang.
Bottle. Black with beige head. Aroma, dark fruits, fruity coffee, caramel, sugar. Taste is fruity dark berries. Black berries.

Bottle. It pours jet black with a creamy beige head. The aroma is deep roasted with chocolate and light berry notes. Creamy texture. Black currant notes in the flavor along with deep roast and some chocolate. Lots by roasted finish.

Close to black body with a red tint. Small tan to maroon head that doesnt stick to the glass. Malty and strong aroma of milk chocolate, chocolate sauce, roasted malt, and fruits. Brown sugar and salty liquorice in the back. Very strong flavour of chocolate, caramel, dark roasted malt, leather, and tart berries. The berries of course remind me of black currants, but that might be the label fooling me; I would probably have claimed to pick up lingonberries if that was printed on the label. Moderate sweet and light acidic taste with a moderate bitter finish. Full body, smooth texture, soft carbonation. A very nice brew, but I prefer the regular Öö version. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 8 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Bottle. Pours a jet black body with a medium creamy beige head. Nose is licorice, chocolate, dark berries, leather, caramel and hints of black currants, bready malts, dark sugars and faint coffee. Taste is dark malts, licorice, leather, minerals, coffee and hints of chocolate and grains, with a whiff of dark berries on the aftertaste. Full body, medium carbonation. Nice one, but I wish for more berries and sweetness from the Baltic Porter-style licorice and leather thing. Still, an enjoyable beer.
Bottle at home, black beer, small to no head. Aroma is fruit, malt, cassis. Taste is the same, sweet with bitter, hint of roast and chocolate, nice one.

Aroma; air, faint malts, dark chocolate n fruit.
Look; black.
Taste; roasted liquoriceish malts, black chocolate with nut, prune, and a liquoriced malted fruity finish.
Feel; good body, gentle n soft.
Overall; good dark sipper, superb taste.
[btl from Kihoskh]

Pours dark brown ,small brown head. Aroma of berries, blackcurrant, cherry, port wine flavour. Some roasted coffee and vanilla. Sweet, bitter and some sour taste. Thick, oily body. Soft carbonation. Good!

Põhjala Öö Cassis
Baltic Porter
748415

Lukt: Kaffe, bek, frukter og sjokolade.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Lite skum.
Smak: Kaffe, frukter og sjokolade.
Hvor: Tasting kveld på Bryne.

Bottle: Served in a Bock glass:
Brown head/lacing. Black beer.
Nose of green leaves, cassis, roast, chalk, berries, light roast, marzipan... quite a complex and interesting aroma...
Flavours of cassis, roast, biscuit, malts, forest fruits, bitters, light sweet, light marzipan, light malt roast... good balance between bitters and sweet. Black and purple...
Aftertaste is bitter, dry, dark fruity, light roast...
Low carbo, creamy silky mouthfeel, medium to lightly fuller bodied.
Good stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Tout comme la ÖÖ originale, versée noire débène avec une mousse brune fine. On est bien en présence dune Baltic Porter avec un vent force 10.5. Le nez est une belle promesse et tient à une combinaison de deux éléments : les malts tout dabord, avec cette charge de café et de cacao impressionnante ainsi que les notes de miel de châtaigne, de sirop dérable, de sucre candi, de caramel, de gelée de coin et de mélasse, et le fruit, avec lajout de cassis qui nous délivre de beaux arômes de pruneau, de fraise des bois, de cerise bigarreau, de sureau, de raisin sec, de banane séchée, de datte et de figue sèches, dabricot, de mûre... On sent la filiation avec sa grande sur à travers une levure présente et un côté légèrement terreux qui hume bon la prairie après la pluie. En bouche, les promesses sont tenues. Alcool de très haute volée, carbonatation faible comme attendue, texture riche et ronde avec une densité monstrueuse et amertume superbe, sèche et capiteuse à la fois. Deuxième gorgée qui sarticule sur les flaveurs de malts avec le fruit en arrière bouche. Équilibre subtil sur une base très puissante, la main de fer dans le gant de velours. Les arômes en arrière-nez avec le liquide en bouche sont une merveille, avec une montée progressive et puissante qui laisse ensuite sexprimer les levures, terreuses et presque fumées comme je le disais précédemment mais avec une belle ligne et cette amertume sèche, tourbée, très longue et légèrement astringente. Le cassis est extrêmement discret au démarrage et il faut boire quelques lampée et faire tourner le liquide sur la langue pour en ressentir la pleine mesure. Cest subtil et très bien joué. Bien entendu, on a les flaveurs de cacao amer et de café en permanence qui jouent des coudes pour savoir lequel des deux prend le dessus. Le final est agréable, long, planant. Il laisse en bouche les traces du passage dAttila, avec une espèce de mâche qui ensuquerait (voir anesthésierait) presque la cavité buccale. Reste aussi du fruit en arrière-bouche malgré un déluge de sensations maltées, cest vraiment un délice. Reste quon ne trouve pas de notes houblonnées hormis lamertume, mais ce nest absolument pas le propos de ce type de produit. Cest équilibré, bien construit, complexe, gourmand. En soxygénant comme un grand vin, cette bière exhale de plus en plus les notes de fruits. Cest vraiment superbe... Au final, cette ÖÖ Cassis est la version Nec Plus Ultra du breuvage original. Comme quoi il ne lui fallait pas forcément grand chose dautre en plus. Juste la cerise (ou le cassis) sur le gâteau. Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

Draught. In aroma awfull acetaldehyde, light porterish chocolate and light fruitiness. In taste bit better (but still with aldehyde) with nice berry fruity tartness added to fine chocolate. Medium to full body, alcohol well hidden. Might be really good without one flaw.
Отличны& портер, приятны& аромат, мощный вкус, черная смороди& ощущает& во вкусе, легкая горчинк& приятно& послевк&

33cl bottle at home from De Caigny, Belgium. Nose is dried fruits, cocoa. Body is black, head is small, brown, frothy, mostly diminishing, fair lacing. Aroma is cocoa, dark chocolate, coffee, licorice, dried fruits, herb liquor. Medium to heavy sweet, heavy bitter, medium fruity sour. Finish is long lasting roasty medium to heavy bitter, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Heavy dessert beer, strong flavor, tasty, nice one.

Bottle from VInmonopolets BU. Pours dark brown to black with a red hue. Small brown head. Ripe berries, blackcurrant, cherry, port wine flavour. Some roasted coffee and vanilla. Sweet, bitter and some sour taste. Thick, oily body. Soft carbonation. Good!
Zwart bier, bruin beige kraag die inzakt tot een randje . Ruikt bessig, alcohol, gebrande mout. Smaak is koffie, bessen vrij zoet. De afdronk is vrij scherp bitterzuur en bederft het een beetje.
Seemed a little too heavy for a baltic porter, but other than that good. Just sweet enough and the aroma is full of chocolate, vanilla, caramel.

Butelka z datą: 05.01.18 (369)
AROMAT: Intensywny. Czekolada z czarną porzeczką. W tle śliwki i rodzynki, delikatna paloność i prażoność.
SMAK: Ciemne słody (zboża, paloność, czekolada). Końcówka porzeczkowa, nieco cierpka (cudo!). Alkohol perfekcyjnie wkomponowany. Odczucie w ustach pełne. 
WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemnobrunatna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, bardzo niska.
OGÓLNIE: Tutaj jest wszystko to co winno być w dobrym PB, a dodatkowo jest ta porzeczka, która wieńczy dzieło. Mój osobisty TOP 5 wśród Porterów Bałtyckich, jakie miałem okazję dotychczas zdegustować.

Black, ncie brownish head. Aroma: chocolate, toast, caramel, subtle notes of black currant. Full body, medium sweetness, medium to high bitterness. Flavour: nice combination of coffee and chocolate with sour fruits. Bit lack of sweetness, too intense bitterness and bit noticable alcohol. Tiring after while.

I like this beer in standard version and I like it with this nice black currant kick, feels ripe and same time dried fruits, berries, deep roast in backgorund, with smooth dark chocolate
and coffee. Awesome

The aroma is full of dark chocolate, black currants, coffee, caramel and vanilla. The color is pitch black and there is no head. The taste is full of dark chocolate, coffee beans, roasted coffee, syrup, vanilla, caramel, tar, tobacco and leather. A nice beer!

Tap at Ministerstwo Browaru Wroniecka, Poznan, PL. What an awesome brew! It has all the good baltic porter should have, and then there are black currants. And they give some sourness, some tartness, which makes the beer like way to drinkable for 10,5% abv. Love it.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2017 330ml bottle. Pours dark brown, mall brown head. Aroma is roasty, prunes, dark chocolatey, dark cherry, blackcurrant. Taste is roasty, sweet, dark cherry, blackcurrant, coffee, some tart. Medium bodied, average carbo. Very well covered alco. Nice brew, easily drinkable.

Black currant, chocolate, coffee in nose. Pours very dark brown with tan head. Taste is medium sweet and medium sour with chocolate, black currant, other forest fruits, coffee. Medium bitter finish, full body, soft carbonation. Overall very good Baltic Porter with nice twist.

Barwa nieprzejrzyście czarna, piany praktycznie brak.Aromat mocno kawowy. Smak natomiast jest bardzo gładki i przyjemny, piwo jest niezwykle pijalne. Czuć czekoladę oraz nuty owocowe, jest slodkie. Podsumowując, piwo zdecydowanie warte polecenia.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, berries
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, medium bitterness, light sweetness, 
Palate-full body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Keg at Mother Kellys, 09/02/17.
Black with a decent tan covering.
Nose is chocolate, spice, charr, liquorice, red berry tang.
Taste comprises black forest gateaux, toffee fudge, chocolate, light hop notes, charr, roast malt, spice.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, warming booze with an overly sweet climax but tempered with the red berry elements.
Solid BP.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: FEB 21, 2017 Draft at Brewdog Berlin. Pours pitch black, no head. Nose is bread, cassis, chocolate, coffee. Palate is a crazy mixture of sweet, and fruity notes, with the cassis coming through nicely, it develops into oily mouthfeel, a bit earthy, complex bitter notes. Wow!! This is such a nicely balance complex beer, the alcohol is hidden perfectly. With sweetness almost barley wine like, but this great cassis Antrunk makes it not too sweet.

Bottle at hops beer bar. Nice black colour small brown head. Nose is cocoa light sourness. Taste is strog roasted malts, definitve choholate, low booze strog currants in the aftertaste. Like a blafkncurrant chocholate. Lovely.

Eksperyment ciekawy, aczkolwiek piwo bazowe przykrywa porzeczkę. Tak jak w przypadku piwa bazowego zbyt ciężki jak na bałtyk. Aromat ciemnych słodów w typie czekolady gorzkiej, kawy, uzupełniają nieco przytłoczone, owoce porzeczki.

Keg at Mother Kellys - London. Pours black-brown with a creamy, beige head. Interesting aroma, some dried berries, dark fruits, inklings of cocoa. Medium sweet flavour with understated bittersweet chocolate, raisins, subtle earthy bitterness, some burnt marshmallows, restrained alcohol presence. Medium to full bodied, slightly chewy, with fine, massaging carbonation. Good balance in the finish, with more dried berries, light balancing bitterness, a little gooey chocolate, soft roast, more burnt marshmallows, a little toffee. Drinks incredibly well for the ABV.

Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana brązowa, szybko znika niemalże do zera. Bardzo duże wysycenie. W aromacie czuć niedojrzałe orzechy włoskie, śliwkę, delikatny spód od chleba w tle. W smaku co prawda porzeczka jest umowna i mocno schowana, to pierwsze skrzypce grają nuty kawowe, za nimi pojawia się gorzka czekolada, trochę bombonierka. Gęste, treściwe. Smaczne ale lekko cierpkie. Alkohol bardzo dobrze ukryty, tak samo zresztą jak w wersji podstawowej.

Pours pitch black, topped with minimal cream colored head. Chocolate and very gentle roaastiness aroma upfront with some fruity presence in the back. Sweet start with chocolate followed by a very strong sweetness of black currant, syrupy that later on changes into roasted tones in the aftertaste. Gentle alcohol that gets a bit more noticeable. Very creamy body.

I bought this bottle at Beer Lovers in Austria. I drank it with Fred and my family in Lausanne. In my opinion, it is just a perfect beer, beautiful and one of the best that I tried in my life. The body is a consistent black body, thin and brown foam. For the style, the carbonation is regular. The taste is in the mouth amazing, an explosion of red fruits, roasted, malt, coffee, vanilla, licor, hop and well balanced, you dont have the impression that this beer has 10.5 degrees, complex and to drink carefully, I could drink one entire boat of this one to reach the paradise of the beer hunters, next one please.

W aromacie dużo śliwki, są orzechy, czekolada, lekkie pralinki, liść porzeczki i wyraźna cierpkość. W smaku ogólnie rzecz biorąc powtórka z tego, jest śliwka, rodzynki, gładka faktura, nieco czekolady i co odróżnia tę wersję od podstawki, to porzeczkowa cierpkość. Trochę mało mi tej porzeczki w tym piwie. Tak czy tak, fajna wariacja na temat świetnego porteru Pohjali.

Zdecydowanie mi nie podpasowało. Porzeczka jednak zdominowała to piwo w aromacie i w smaku, zamiast być delikatnym dodatkiem. Trochę mulące na dłuższą metę, przez co miałem problem z dopiciem. Samo w sobie ok, struktura podobna do podstawy, jednak dla mnie doznania zupełnie inne. Trochę się męczyłem.

Pours black with short tan head. Aromas of slick dark fruit, oily coffee, rich chocolate and toasted malt with a bit of alcohol. Flavors follow same but substitute dark fruit with black currant and blueberries. Wow - just like dark chocolate covered currants steeped in alcohol. Beauty.

Pitch black, particulate color with thin, quickly disappearing espresso head. Aroma is dark malts, dark chocolate, black currants, walnuts, chocolate liquor-like alcohol. Taste is modrately sweet that evolves to mildly bitter towards the end. It follows the nose with notes of dark chocolate, black currants and a boozy kick in the aftetaste. No ashy or burnt flavours. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel. Overall an extremely smooth and warming baltic porter.
Aika rapean tuhkainen ja rusinainen. Öljyinen, tumma, tuima ja maukas. Kivasti kuivahko.

Bottle 330ml. @ home. [ As Põhjala Öö Cassis ].Clear dark black brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, dark malt, roasted, chocolate, blackcurrant, wood. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, light acidic and moderate bitter with a long duration, tart blackcurrant, roasted, chocolate, dark malt. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20170110]
 8-4-7-4-16
Malziger, dunkel schokoladig-beeriger Antrunk. Dadurch dezent säuerlich, steigende Schokoladenaromen. Vollmundig, weich, langer Nachhall, wenig alkoholisch, komplexe Fruchtnoten. 12/12/12/12/11/12

UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, piana konkretna, utrzymająca się cały czas. W aromacie porzeczka, czekolada, kawa. W smaku pełne, smak porzeczki, kawa i czekolada, szystko znakomicie skomponowane. Bardzo dobre piwo.
_____
wersja butelkowa: Aromat nizebyt intensywny, ale złożony, dopiero po ogrzaniu wychodzi porzeczka. Piana ładna, zostawiająca otoczkę. Smak nadal super, gładkie niczym adriatyk w środku lata. Bardzo dobre piwo, ale k..., ta porzeczka ma być w każdej temp...

[Kran BrewDog Warszawa]
Wygląd: Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, niemal brak piany.
Aromat: Porzeczkowy, czekoladowy, kawowy, coś jakby lambic w tle.
Smak: Zdecydowana słodycz, porzeczki, kawa i czekolada.
Podsumowanie: Naprawdę dobre, ale niektórzy narzekać będą na zbyt wyraźne owoce. Czy jest lepsze od wersji podstawowej? Z pewnością jest inne, lecz mi obydwa smakowały na równi.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2017 Frisch vom Hahn im Muted Horn. Schwarz, fast ölig. Cassis dominiert und subtile Bittre. Später kommt Kaffee durch und schwarze Schokolade.

Aroma: black currant, chocolate, caramel, some roasty notes
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, black currant, chocolate, caramel, nuts, roasty

Bottle from TidensFarver, Aarhus. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, black currants, chocolate, dark fruits and berries. Full body. Creamy mouthfeel, Soft carbonation. Slightly bitter finish.

From tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma has black currants, roasted malts, light cherries, slight cinnamon? chocolate and toffee. Taste is sweet, spicy, again slight cinnamon, subtle black currant acidity leading to a medium bitter finish. Full body and a low carbonation.
Porzeczki, likier kawowy/czekoladowy, sporo brzydkiego alko w smaku, lekka owocowa kwasowość. Niezłe ciało.

@Lakeuden Panimojuhlat 2017. Black colour, mediumsized brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, liquorice, black currants, chocolate and some slight alcohol sweetness to it. Flavour is sweet liquorice, roasted malts, some black currants and also some wood and nice bitter notes as well. Alcohol gives a slight kick in the finish.
W aromacie dużo porzeczek, potem kawa i czekolada. W smaku czekolada, lekka kwaśność od porzeczki, sporo alkoholu.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Öö Cassis by Põhjala at BrewDog WarszawaSuper ukryte alko, bardzo owocowo, dosc palono, troche czekoladowo, gladko choc nie jakos duzo ciala, bardzo pijalne, klasa - 4.0Rami Rami is drinking a Öö Cassis by Põhjala at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaW porownaniu do lanego: duzo wiecej porzeczki, mniej czekolady, i duzo wiecej alko - baaardzo duza ta roznica. Na korzysc lanego - 3.8Ocenka usrednionaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Huge thanks to Erzengel for sharing!

Pours quite dark reddish brown to black colour with a huge good lasting tan head. Aroma of dark berries, plums, some quices, dark roasted malt. Taste of sweet dark malt, rich fruitiness, plums, chocolate, cassis, some alcohol.

Tap @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of dark chocolate and black currents. Black with tan head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate bitter, light sweet and light fruit sour. Full body, oily feel and roasted malt and black current finish.

Black color with mocha head. Aroma has really nice fudge and brownies with dark fruits. Taste follows with nice fruity notes, slightly tart and also a bit acidic, maybe also from the roasted malt. Medium to full bodied, low carbonation. Overall its a really nice combination.

Bottle. Teku. Pitch black with medium, light brown, thick head. Moderate head retention and lacing. Moderately malty aroma - mainly roasted malts (milk chocolate, cocoa), slightly vanilla, toasted, slightly woody. The maltiness is broken by some fresh dark fruits notes - not so pronounced. Taste is moderately sweet and moderately bitter. Here the cassis are more pronounced - nice acidic notes, stable, thru the whole of degustation with some cocoa mildness. Medium body, oily and creamy texture, soft to average carbonation. Finish is cocoa, acidic, semi-bitter and slightly ashy. In general nice brew, based on chocolate notes, nicely ABV hidden, moderately drinkable. The cassis are nicely composed here. Decent brew, something more than average definitely.

Bottle. Dark body, medium head. Deep roasty aroma with some unsweet red berries. Not as strongly blackcurranty as I expected it to be. Taste has the regular Öö with some herbal notes - more like the leaves of blackcurrant, rather than the berries. Mildly sourish finish with a dry berry influence. Still decent but not as fruity or jammy as I wanted it to be.

Bottle from Tidens Farver, Aarhus. Black with a lasting dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, caramel, chocolate and black currants. Flavour is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. Oily. 140117

33cl bottle. Very dark brown pour with a medium-height tan head. Notes of smoke, roasted malts, bitter and lightly sour berries, a fruity metallic component, chocolate, brewed coffee. Full body, medium to low carbonation and a bitter and light tart finish. A good example of what a fruited imperial stout should taste like.

Many thanks to my Secret EU-Santa martjoobolut for this bottle! Great deep roasted nose. Mild roasted beginning with a nice combination of cassis and roasted malts. Intense deep with a great fruity layer. Long and sticky, roasty and fresh. Great easy to drink fruity Baltic Porter.

Bottle from Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Aroma is dark malt, roast, dark fruits, tart berries, strong black currant, cocoa, dark chocolate, liquorice. Flavour is medium sweet and moderate bitter with some tartness from the berries and a little alcohol. Body is medium to full. Tasty, excellent bittersweet flavour, the aroma is a bit too heavily dominated by the black currant though.

Bottle, pours black with a beige head. Roasty, with good presence of black currants, chocolate, fruity, thick. The fruity sourness is balancing the sweetness very well, making this dangerously drinkable. Great stuff.

the aroma: caramel and roasted malt, sweet garden berries, flowers, red wine, brown chocolate and dark fruits... the taste: caramel and roasted malt, port, black chocolate, toffee, toast, black currant and dried plum... the aftertaste: sweet, dry and warming...

Pours Black with a beige head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, black currants, Cocoa, vanilla and dark chocolate. Taste of dark berries, roasted malts, Coffee and dark chocolate. Better than expected. Black currants blends pretty good!

BOTTLE 33 CL. Pitch black, dark espresso head. Think inky porter aroma, really dark malts and some fruity tannins (not exactly currants). The taste is mighty chocolaty - in the Baltic way, with that hoppy husky bitter edge - garnished with a nice tart and tannic fruity accent. Really good.

Pitch black with a desnse brown head. Heavy sweet, alchool, some roasted malt. Flavor is heavy sweet and bitter with notes of warm alchhol, roasted malt, cocoa. Creamy mouthfeel, bitter and roasted aftertase.

330ml bottle. Dark brown opaque beer, brown head. Nose is black currants, roast, coffee notes, something lactic. Flavor is berry-centric with lots of black currant, berry acidity, roast, chocolate. Berry finish with roast and chocolate, mild sweetness. The dryness and acidity make for almost a red wine quality.

Dark dark brown with medium not so stable brown head. Roasted grain aroma with coffee and berries notes. Strong bitterness with roasted grain, coffee and chocolate notes on the background of good blackcurrant sweet-sourness. Strong lasting bitter aftertaste with shorter berries sweet-sourness.

Pours black with medium beige head. Aroma is wine, grapes, dry, some oak, black currant, berries, spices. Taste is red wine, bereies, grapes, currant, juice, home made wine, roast, oak, wood, some sourness. Abv is very well hidden, long and sour aftertaste, well balanced. Superb beer!

(33 cl bottle from Brus bottleshop; BBD: October 3rh 2017; Batch #314) Poured at fridge temperature into a Põhjala teku reveals a pitch black body with one finger of toffee head that persists nicely and leaves lace. Aroma has roasted malt, rye bread, a bit of chalk as well as some dark fruits. Oily texture, soft carbonation, full body and a warming finish. Flavour has roasted malt tinged with a slightly tart berry hint that complements the profile well. There is some sweetness in there too. Booze is well masked although its presence is not in dispute it acts to enhance the flavour and mouthfeel and and encourages you to sip the beer without adding undesirable snakebite or medicinal qualities to the beer. Quite enjoyable.

(Keg at William K Kurvi, 20161216) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had burnt malts and black currant juice. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were burnt malts, sweetness, black currant juice, ash and bitterness. Aftertaste had burnt malts, black currants and bitterness. A matching blend but not much better than the plain Öö.

black liquid with brown head. aroma of black currants, raw banana, chocolate. taste has black currant, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, medium sweet, meedium bitter, light+ sour. medium body, creamy feel, average carbonisation, long finish

Bottle. Pours black with medium beige head. Berries, chocolate, roasted malts, and some booze in aroma. Taste is little bit sourish at first with berries and blackcurrant, balanced with chocolate and coffee notes. Medium body and carbonation. Very nice brew.

A lovely combination of roasted malts from the porter and black currants. Coffee, chocolate, roast, fruits. Sweetness countered by the sour fruits. A light bitter finish. Well balanced and quite complex. Very good!

Bottle at home.
Pitch black coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel, chocolate and blackcurrants.
Roasted flavour of caramel, chocolate and blackcurrants.
Roasted finish.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Soviel ist klar, hier handelt es sich um die Schwergewichtsklasse. ÖÖ!? A Legend. Au ja, das ÖL!!! Da war ja was 😉. Die Nase sofort auf hundertachtzig. Phenoloröstogrando + schwerwiegende Fassvergötterung. Und die schwarze Sauerbeere läßt auch schon gucken. Halleluja....ich glaub der Trunk fetzt..😎 
.....Oh wow...das nenn ich mal rezent oder auch einfach nur gewagt versourbeerte VerÖÖung. What the shit??? The Beer Geek Heaven !? Lang und freundlich exzentrisch...🎡. 0,33/4,50. BEYOND BEER HH. Bottle.
And the Winner is....🎉????

33cl bottle from 100 Beers. Black in color with a dense mocha head. The aroma is big currant, dark chocolate, toffee, some chalky notes. Big sweet mocha flavor with dark chocolate, cassis, and a nicely bitter hoppy finish. The feel is quite clean and slick, with soft carbonation. Legit.

33 cl bottle.
Pours pitch black color with a large beige head. Dark berries on the nose, roasted malts, dark chocolate and mild hop notes. Flavor is also a bit too much dominated by the berries, subtle tartness, roasted malty and dark chocolaty. Too much berries here.
4424

Bottle at home (bb 031017, batch 314). Pours dark with a tan head. Aroma of black currants with a herbal juniper hint to it, could even be some infection, light underlying roasted malts and chocolate. Taste is moderate bitter and over moderate sweet, black currant, roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, aftertaste of bitter roasted malts and chocolate. Not sure about this one.

Draught at Brewers Beer Bar, November 28, 2016.Black color, small brown head. Malty, alcohol, slight banana, hint bitter taste. Black currant, bitter, alcohol aftertaste. Warming alcohol, Smooth mouthfeel, a tad fizzy CO2. Malty, alcohol, fruity scent, some wet tobacco.Served very cold.Some smoke in scent and taste when warming up, also more evident tartness in taste and aftertaste, presumably from the added black currants.I personally would likely enjoy this even better with more distinct black currants and perhaps less of an evident alcohol touch.

330 ml. bottle @ Beerlovers Bar. 03 10 17. Black, creamy solid head. Nose is thick herbal molasses, syrup, thick black currant jelly, umami, licorice, herbal. Taste is herbal syrup mixed with thick black currant syrup, thick syrup, herbal syrup, molasses, low roast, umami, sweet, low umami, very thick syrupy dark berries. Body is thick molasses, herbal, licorice. Not easy do drink. Umami, thick herbal syrup much like the base. Good variant of the regular beer, liked it about the same.

How: Draught.
Where: All in Beer Fest 2016.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, black currants, chocolate.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Black currants, chocolate, some fruit.
Deep black with a light beige head. Aroma is a bit of sour milk and lots of fresh forest berries. Taste is distinctively blackcurrant. Big alcohol punch.
Thnx to elisse Pours black, good head smell is Rich, Sharp fruit, dark roasty malts. Taste is sharp, fruit sour touch. Very nicely balanced.
Pours black with medium head. Aroma: a lot of dark roasted malt and blackcurrant, some vanilla. Taste: again nice porter styled dark malt and a clear blackcurrant profile fitting very well.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, blackcurrant, liquorice, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown/black beer with a slight/medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit, blackcurrant, liquorice, and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Super sweet at the start with the added fruit distinctly noticeable. The roast and even coffee that comes at the end balances the whole thing amazingly well.
Black body, brown head. Aroma has sweet roasted maltiness, chocolate, some generic berries and dark fruitiness. Flavour is quite bitter and dry with red port like notes.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is blackcurrant, chocolate, liquorice, taste is sweet chocolate, toffee, tart fruit.

Bottle @ Tidens Farver, Aarhus. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, coffee, dark chocolate, rich blackcurrant, light cinnamon notes. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, licorice, chocolate, tart rich berries, blackcurrant, light alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 191116

Bottle, 10.5%. Black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, black currant and coffee. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, smoke, coffee, berries, black currant, sweet, hop, little liquorice and medium bitter.

Appearance: black, clear, brown foam, rocky head, lasts well. Aroma: roasty, bread, alcohol, blackcurrant appears after a while but it is there!, Taste: medium sourness, medium bitterness, heavy cloying sweetness, wow! roasty. Palate: medium body, thin feel, creamy, average carbonation, long bitter finish,

330ml bottle. Pours almost black. Moderate beige head. Lots of blackcurrants in the aroma. Hints of chocolate, hints of bread, hints of cocoanibs, earthy notes as well. Blackcurrants at first. Chocolate, hints of cocoa in the middle. Notes of berries. Chocolaty finish. Berries, cocoa and chocolate in the aftertaste. Really well balanced, rather medium bodied, very well drinkable, very enjoyable brew.

Draught at All In Beer Fest 2016 Session 2, 2016-11-05 Göteborg
 AR: dark chocolate, wee dark berries
AP: black, wee thin brown head
F:vinos red, dark bitter dry chocolate, complex, wee red fruity
Tap at pub. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma is cocoa and dried fruits. Taste is cocoa, coffee and bitter berries. Really nice Baltic porter.
0,33l fles uitgeschonken zwart met fijne bruine kraag. Espresso met zwarte bessen diepe mokka en salmiak afdronk. Nice

Tap at Beer Hunters. Opaque black-brown color, steady brownish head. Woody, toasted, sweetish nose. Full-bodied. Sweetish, toasted, a bit earthy. Cassis is not dominating but it makes normal Öö sweetier and berryish.

Bottle.
Dark, a bit reddish head. Nice dark berries, wine aroma. Taste: berries, sweet/bitter, warming. Full body. Very nice.

Draught at the Konttori, Tampere, Finland.
Black color with a small brown head.
Cookies, sweet caramel, roasted malt, sweetness, mild berries and some licorice in the aroma. Nice.
The flavor is roasted malt, ashy dryness, licorice, some black current and bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
101116. Tap at Konttori, Tampere. Pours black with a nice head. Aroma chocolate, hops, roasted malts. Slightly sweet taste. Without the blackcurrant probably even better. Not Bad.
Sample at All In Beer Fest 2016. Black with tanned head. Roasted malt with coffee and chocolate with a light sour and sweet black currant and berries finish. Nice!
Tap @ Konttori. Pours black with a light beige creamy head. Black currant, roasted malts, licorice in the aroma. Sweet, roasted, smooth, berries flavor.

Pours dark with low tanned head
Aromas of black currant, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee
Taste has notes of black currant, liqourize, brown sugar, alcohol, chocolate, coffee, soy
Sample at All In Beer Fest 2016. Sweet taste with caramel, coffee, dark chocolate and roasted. Similar taste but with some crushed flower stalks.

Bottled. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma of roasty malts, licorice, black current, coffee and dark chocolate. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Porter indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2016 Tap (OlutExpo2016) (7:4:6+:3:13+=3.3++)
Chris didnt want me to drink this. "Dont serve that man beer" he said. Unfortunately, Samu ignored him! Berry-dominant aroma, quite sharp and harsh blackcurrant, but in combination with the richness of the roast, it somehow works, and makes you want to dive in. Dark, small tan head. Taste delivers exactly what was promised, and I kinda feel like I should have paid more attention to the harshness of the berries there. Fortunately theres a sweetness that helps knock the top off the sharp edges of the berries. Quite berry dominated, and not necessarily in a way I go mad over.
Rerate: Tap (Koht, Tallinn) - marduks glass
More like cherry in this one, nice, less harsh than the purer blackcurrant of the first sample. Covers alc well. Easily 3.8.
Rerate: Tap (Koht, Tallinn) - marts glass
One hour later, same keg, and its a different beer. Harsher. Still decent, but back to the 3.3-3.4 zone. (Anna adds: this one is less of an easy drinker and is dominated by spices, maybe from near the bottom of the keg, and the once cherry-like fruitiness isnt obvious) 
(Aside, the "Did I do a bad rating?" from the original template rating is a reference to the British comedy "Psychoville".)
Rerate: Tap (Koht, Tallinn) (7:4:7:4:14)
Lots of banana skins and strings in the aroma. Black, tiny tan head. Sweetish palate, but not too sticky because it has a nice carbonation level. Taste is pleasantly roasty, still has a banana string aspect. Cassis working pretty well here. Why is there banana here? Who cares - this is moreish!

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2016 Tap at Koht. Dark brown with tan head that dissipated quite fast. Really nice, moist chocolate and berry cake aroma, fudgey, with cocoa nibs and deep roast. The blackcurrant is beautifully integrated with the whole. Deep dark chocolate and some pleasant sourish blackcurrants in flavour. A bit of licorice too. Thick full mouthfeel, fine but somewhat zingy carbonation. Alcohol well hidden except for a little pleasant warmth coating the palate. Excellent stuff.

Edit: Bottle; batch 314; BB 03.10.2017. Looks the same. Aroma pretty much the same, less as cocoay, more black currants and chocolate cake, really nice mix of sweet chocolate and sour berries. In the flavour I get some faint aniseed moments (as before). Alcohol so well hidden... Excellent times 2! I love this.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 Draught @ OlutExpo 2016. Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of berries, roasty malts, licorice, coffee, dark chocolate and oatmeal. Taste is sweetish, roasty and heavy with some berries, licorice, coffee, rye, blackcurrant and syrup. Finish is sweetish and roasty with notes of rye, blackcurrant, berries and hints of licorice. Quite heavy and massive imperial stout with some berry notes that fit in quite nicely.

@OlutExpo16black. Rubbery roasty maltyness, black curranty, curranty leafy nose. Full bodied, or full med, doesnt cloy, doesnt feel thick, quite ok drinkable. Good bitters, black currants. Clean finish. Intense.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tap. Very dark brown color. Small size, brown head, stays. Roasted malts, bit ashy, over ripped black currant in aroma. Roasted malts, black currant internals, fruity in taste. Fckin smooth. Feels like lying under the black currant shrub and squeezing soft jammy part of the berry in me mouth. Delicious! Alcohol is hidden. Brilliant brew!

Draught at Kaisla. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, hops, blackberries, coffee, earthy notes, a bit of chocolate and nuts. Bitter finish with roasted malts, hops, blackberries, coffee, nuts and chocolate. Very nice brew.

Tap at koht. Pours dark brown-black with brownish head. Aroma is massive fresh blackcurrant, some malt and roast. Flavor is sour, sweet, bitter, blackcurrant, malt, roast, some spiciness even. Finish is roast and blackcurrant slight alcohol. Alcohol is mostly covered. Overall: very nice.
Tap at olutexpo. Black with not much head. Roasted, burned, sweetness, strong round bitterness, thick texture-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
A small taste from a friend (tap) @ Olut Expo 2016. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and cassis. Flavor is roasted malts, cassis, alcohol and hops. Good.
Tap at Olutexpo 2016, Helsinki. Colour is reddish dark with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, red berries, blue berries, sweetness, coffee and malts. Not bad. Nice dry berries.

Draught @ Olutexpo 2016. 
Pours black color with a thin brown head. 
Aroma has roastedness, licorice, spicy notes, blackcurrant. 
Flavor has roastedness, blackcurrant, oat, mild sourness, some wood. Nicely balanced. Dry finish. Much tastier than the basic version.

bottle from our local bottle shop, poured a black colour with a darker tanned head. nose of roasted malts, dark chocolate, red fruits, coffee, toffee fudge, black currants shines when the beer starts to warm up. light chocolate bitter aftertaste. nice addition

On tap at Whats Brewing, Stavanger. Pours very dark brown, almost pitc black with a small beige head. Inviting aroma of blackcurrant, weak roasted malts and liquorice. Taste is good malty, berries, loaded with blackcurrant, some liquorice, smooth mouthfeel, overall a very nice and enjoyable beer.

On tap at Speakeasy, Tallinn. Dark as the night with a fairly modest, beige head. Strong roasty aroma with notes of coffee, bitter dark chocolate, blackcurrant and hints of dark fruits and wood. Medium sweet with dominant roasty flavours with notes of black currants and a mild acidity. Feels a bit raw and rough around the edges, some aging might make it smoother. Still a rather nice one, but I do prefer the original to this one.

Draft sample at Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 04.07.2016. Day Two. Pour it dark color with small white head. Aroma really crazy strange roasted malt with vanilla. Taste nice sweet caramel, roasted malt, some chocolate on the back, woody fell, nice barrel aged, good balanced, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish.
A pretty good basic porter. Nice black currant tint to the flavor. Aroma is mostly chocolate. Tried at the Oedipus international beer festival in 2016.
Tap at Oedipus fest. Aroma of boozy red fruit, malt and chocolate. Smooth taste of soft berries, roasted malt, red fruit, vanilla, chocolate, coffee and a long warming finish. Very good.

On tap at OIBF16. Black colour, beige head. Aroma of liquorice, blackcurrant, berries, roasted malts, some pumpernickel. Flavour is light to medium sweet, light tart, liquorice, berries, pumpernickel, chocolate, roasted malts, bitter finish with a light berry tartness. Medium bodied. Good.

Tap @ OIBF 16. Color is as good as black. Dense beige/brown head. Aromas: roast, fruit, berries, light sour, roasted. Retronasal theres drop/licorice, roast, sweet & sour fruit/berries. Flavor is droppy, moderate sweet with a salty/umami edge. Medium bodied. Interesting.

Draft at Oedipus International Beer Festival. Black with a small beige head. Aroma of roast, coffee, dark chocolate, toffee, fudge and light black current showing up. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Sampled from tap at the Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Pitch black with a beige head. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty and a little fruity aroma of milk chocolate, some coffee, blackcurrant and some licorice. Sweet, malty, a little fruity and slightly roasty taste of dark chocolate, coffee, licorice and some blackcurrant, followed by a medium long, quite roasty-bitter finish. Medium to full body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!
